page.title: 11Energy Sources.
page.content: {Electricity.}Two years ago an aerogenerator was installed (with the help of a helicopter).It cost Â£40,000 but is fully automatic and when there is sufficient wind it takes over from the diesel generators.Most of the houses now have storage heaters to take advantage of the electricity which is now free.(However the new distribution system and fittings cost a further Â£100,000).If more than 55 KW.are produced a set of grey boxes dissipate the heat and in exceptional winds there are flaps on the rotars which operate to prevent damage.Wind speed and power production can be viewed in comfort on dials in the Tavern.{Bottled Gas.}Imported bottled gas is used for cookers and 'fridges. {Diesel.}As with the gas (and most things on Lundy)this comes via the Polar Bear and a long pull.
